name: Le Meridien Dubai

reviews.text: I was very happy with the service here. Everyone was friendly and very helpful. My bag was lost at DBX and the concierge took all the information, tracked down the bag and had it delivered to my room. Room service was also perfectly fine. The design of the rooms is a bit lacking... more glorified motel than 5 star hotel, particularly the florescent-lit, small and plane bathrooms. Good option for staying close to the airport.
reviews.title: Good service, bit tired design.

reviews.text: This hotel is fine, but not really more than that. In fact, I had reserved the hotel twice: on my way from Cape Town to New York and back. I have cancelled the second time simply because it wasn't worth it.
reviews.title: Adequate, but underwhelmed...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a Royal Club room and they had not put me on a list to be picked up from the airport. Consequently, I waited for 45 minutes at the airport to sort this out. Pretty bad start after a long journey. The Royal Club reception is somewhat run down and check in was fine, although I was charged a hefty fee for 'checking in early' (Given that I didn't stay for 24 hours, I found this rather awkward) But, they played on the fact that you're tired and want to go to bed and cashed in. Room is fine, bathroom ok-ish. I was told that soft drinks were free. Had a soft drink in the pool, but upon check out I was told 'that I took the drink in the wrong pool' and was charged for it. If only they had been clearer about what is the right pool and if only if their staff had instructions about not being petty about a soft drink....it was annoying. I can afford a soft drink, but it was the principle of it and they played by unclear rules. The gym of the hotel was fantastic and made my day. All in all, not a place to go back to. They are in it for the money and hospitality is secondary to that.
reviews.title: Fantastic for stop over or longer stay vacation

reviews.text: Just returned from Dubai. Stayed here for the 6th time. We find this hotel meets with all our expectations and believe this is truly a genuine 5star facility. Reception, rooms, restaurants. leisure facilities and staff are absolutely super. Ideally located for City Centre and Metro which makes travelling very easy and inexpensive. We will return to Dubai next year and this hotel will be our number one choice. Look forward to the next 6 visits!!!
reviews.title: Excellent Value - Perfect for a Dubai Stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Charles and Lesley Kidd, Aberdeen Scotland.
reviews.title: Not Quite 5 Star Second Time Around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from our second visit and were not disappointed. The hotel is a short taxi ride from the airport. We had booked the hotel transfer but objected to 50DHS each so cancelled and took a taxi at 22DHS.
reviews.title: Second visit - just as good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has everything that you need for a few days stop over but we would not want to stay so far out if there for longer. Having said that taxis are cheap enough to go anywhere.
reviews.title: Amazing Luxury not offered in US....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was excellent and the pool area was clean and mainly quiet.
reviews.title: Just booked for 4th return visit!

reviews.text: Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay for a couple of nights.
reviews.title: next to airport; aged hotel good for layovers; Good service and food.

reviews.text: I have stayed here twice, once in January 2010 just after New Years for 4 days then again in May 2010 for a week. Make sure you chekc that it is the Le Meridien closest to the airport. There are a few of them in Dubai. I booked both times the Royal Business Lounge. It is a little more out of the pocket but very worth it. Speakers in the shower with glass walls so you can watch the TV in the bedroom while you shower. With the Royal Business Lounge you are provided with a separate check in where you are provided with what every you wish, fruit wine, beer , juice anything. You can even give them your CC and head to your room where they will bring your paperwork back to you in minutes while you start to relax. There are 6 or 7 restaurants in back, The Meridien Villiage, along with a night club....I wouldn't suggest you bring your girlfriend or wife there !o) Through the Royal reservations you are provided with different taxis, Lexus and very nice. They make you feel like a king and Queen. The Airport is around the block and you'd be amazed at the silence. There is a spa in back as well, but remember in Dubai it's a different culture from the US and a woman will not be able to massage a man and vice-verse.
reviews.title: A hotel as it should be, anytime again!

reviews.text: The hotel was very welcoming when we entered the lobby but the rooms were old. specially the bathroom was not very clean.
reviews.title: Good but can improve

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But, the staff was very friendly. also, the room service was very fast. the location is very good. A good Hotel for about one day. if renovated the hotel can be much more pleasant place.
reviews.title: A Real 5 Star Experience and Amazing Value for Money!

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and can't say enough good things about it. From the moment we arrived we were treated like VIPs, the customer service is absolutely excellent and nothing is too much trouble.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings about this hotel

reviews.text: We were given a complimentary upgrade on arrival which was a lovely surprise and much appreciated.
reviews.title: good, functional hotel with excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has 4 pools, and although we only used the Art & Tech pool, all the pools looked amazing. The Art & Tech is a lovely area with swim up bar and lots of very comfortable loungers. Again the pool staff are attentive but not intrusive.
reviews.title: Marvelous hotel and excellent service all round

reviews.text: Enjoyed my one night at le Meridien in late August, and can recommend the hotel. Although my organization paid, I would stay there again if I were paying out of my pocket. The room was very comfortable, almost opulent, and the staff were competent and accommodating. My only criticism is that if you don't want to pay the high price fixe for breakfast in the restaurant and would rather go a la carte, they escort you across the hall to a place that they have cordoned off in what looks like a bar with a temporary room divider. This is where you have breakfast if you don't want to pay the $20 or whatever it is for breakfast in the restaurant. It feels a bit cobbled together and segregated. I'd recommend that they keep everyone in the restaurant and let people go a la carte if they want to. Otherwise, great place!
reviews.title: Pleasant stay, more than fair room rate

reviews.text: Had a nightmare of a trip getting home which involved an overnight stay in Dubai during Ramadan, after having an overnight stay in Kuala Lumpur after an overnight stay in Labuan, (Malaysia Airlines - a whole different review!) but my company booked me into this hotel and all the woes slipped off. Smiling. Everybody was doing it. All the staff seemed genuinely happy to see me. Nothing was too much trouble. Everywhere was clean and to a high standard. It appears that some rooms may have been upgraded. Poolside rooms seem better than smoking rooms.
reviews.title: Exceptional service

reviews.text: The Dubliners bar was great for a South African and a Scot. The restaurants in the hotel all looked great, but we were there at the wrong time. Iftar during Ramadan is very busy.
reviews.title: Very nice stay for the competitive price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't bother with transit bus. I was asked if I was travelling business class as only business travellers can get the hotel bus which you have to pay for anyway. So I just ignored the desk guy complaining at me and grabbed a convenient and cheap taxi.
reviews.title: Convenient for the Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In conclusion, This hotel is the perfect overnighter. Plenty of pools to soak off the days troubles and soak up the sun, and every member of staff smiling and apparently aware that I'm famous and super rich and related to royalty.
reviews.title: Smoking Rooms are very smelly - staff not too helpful

description: A resort-style city hotel set in acres of verdant sub-tropical gardens, Le Méridien Dubai offers the finest setting for business and leisure travellers. Central to everything in the city, this Dubai hotel is considered the premier gateway haven for the well-travelled visitors to the vibrant emirate of Dubai. Sophistication is unveiled by the elegant atmosphere of our rooms and suites. Dining at Le Méridien Dubai temptingly blends the familiar and extraordinary. 18 distinctly styled restaurants and bars offer the most sought-after dining experience in the area.The extensive leisure facility encompasses a leading edge fitness facility, 4 outdoor temperature-controlled swimming pools, flood-lit tennis courts and a luxurious spa.
